result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Quezaire

records.addlTxt:
10:31 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Michael A Quezaire in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Michael A Quezaire.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Nimmer provides an update; she still needs additional time to review discovery and may file a motion as well.  Atty. Nimmer requests a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:30 AM Defendant Michael A Quezaire appeared by zoom video and phone.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Michael A Quezaire.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Jack Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Prior: 833 N 24Th St Apt. #101, Milwaukee, WI 53233 United States
Request for Zoom filed by PD
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
